If the transformation \\( T(z) \\) is applied to an initial state \\( z(0) \\) and then allowed to evolve under \\( \\frac{dz}{dt} = i\\omega z \\) without further intervention, will \\( z(t) \\) at t = T be the same as if \\( z(0) \\) was directly evolved to t = T under \\( \\frac{dz}{dt} = i\\omega z \\)?
Explanation: The integral transformation modifies the initial conditions and the evolution path by accumulating complex exponential weighted integrals of \\( z(t) \\), which fundamentally alters \\( z(t) \\) over time, making the final state at t = T differ from untransformed evolution.
